Been going to this shop for about two years, always consistent professional service with little wait time.

I'm glad that I have found this massage and spa. They just opened in August this year, 2020. It's a beautifully designed high-end building. They have spared no expense in putting together an exquisite premises with state-of-the-art equipment.

There are steam rooms on the ground floor which do the trick with the steam passing through some herbs. There is no time limit as often happens in other spas.

At the present time at the end of October 2020, they have a 60% discount on both foot and body massage. It's a real deal!

Everybody at the spa is very professional and polite and the quality of the massage is good. Seemingly, they have their own unique style of massage there at Lush Spa

I've had 7 massages there and thoroughly recommend the place.

Totally not recommended! I went there after reading Google reviews and seeing the photos, but all six of us completely regretted it. There were no staff on site, and after waiting about 10 minutes, a few massage ladies arrived one by one on motorcycles to take care of each person in our group. During my treatment, the razor was so dull that it felt like it was scraping my skinâ€”it was extremely painful. Later, I noticed several cuts on my chin. They didnâ€™t trim my nails until the very end, and when I finally asked, they only did mine; the other masseuses had already left. I completely regret going. If you still decide to go after reading this review, youâ€™ll likely have the same terrible experience. Go ahead and try if you dare, haha.

Super happy with our massages at Uyen Spa in DaNang!
My wife and I budget our days by spending less on lunch and dinner and try to get a massage twice a week. We look for massage deals and I generally will leave a review if we are sincerely happy with a particular place.
We each had a 90 minute oil massage. Each therapist has their own style of course. Communication was good. They speak some English. Pressure was perfect for us both. Not light but not painful either. They even did a hot stone treatment for us that we didn't expect. It was pretty awesome!
The staff at Uyen went out of their way to make our experience great. To begin their prices are excellent. The tables are very comfortable. The inside temperature was perfect. They actually have an elevator for customers. They have scooter parking directly in front of the business. They even turned our scooter around so we wouldn't have to before we left. So many thoughtful things they took care of for us. We will definitely return!
We just returned from another visit to UyÃªn Spa. Han and Vivi were our awesome therapists today. This time we had the shampoo and facial as well as a 90 minute massage. It was fantastic! We sincerely appreciate how we are treated every visit at UyÃªn Spa. The young lady who greets us is a joy to know and the owner is very nice too!
Another great experience at Uyen Spa this afternoon! Uyen is a wonderful lady. Her entire staff is equally nice. We always get treated with courtesy and respect. The massages we get are excellent. Dear Luna,

This marks my final session after six months, and I want to thank you for sending me these photos. I truly appreciate everything youâ€™ve done to help improve my skin.

Iâ€™ve lived abroad for seven years and spent thousands on spa treatments and other skincare solutions, yet my scars and acne persistedâ€”until I found Luna. I purchased nearly 10 combined sessions, including Chemical Peels, Microneedling, and HydraFacial, though Microneedling was the primary focus. All the equipment is state-of-the-art, and the space is impeccably clean, bright, and extremely tidy.

By the fifth session, I noticed a visible improvement in my skin and wanted to buy more sessions because I loved the service. However, the owner politely declinedâ€”and thatâ€™s another reason I respect this place. She prioritizes honesty and genuine care over pushing unnecessary sales, recommending only whatâ€™s truly needed. The staff are all highly professional, attentive, and well-trained, fully focused on delivering exceptional results.

Expensive treatments arenâ€™t always good, but good treatments are rarely cheap. Instead of complaining about prices, invest in qualityâ€”and youâ€™ll finally see the results youâ€™ve been dreaming of.

This is my 2nd visit to her clinic from Australia for botox. I've now come to Yuki  2 years in a row  now and I highly recommend her any beauty treatment. She's gentle and very professional within her field. She listens and delivers and her English language skills are excellent.
Her products she uses are far more better then Australia's and last much longer, which is what us ladies want. Her prices are very reasonable and has you return in 3 days for check up and touch up for free.
Yuki deserves more then 5 ğŸŒŸ for her services, thank you  Yuki, and see you again next year! ğŸ˜˜

What a horrific experience.
I've always struggled with light acne, mostly around my forehead and chin. So naturally I went in for an acne treatment. The extractions were extremely painful, my face was horrifically swollen and hurt for hours. Most of the things she poked at weren't even actual pimples, just some barely visible bumps.

By the end of the day, every single one of the her little "extractions" had turned into a substantial pimple. Every. Single. One. I look diseased, skin is dry and stiff, and what's left of my vacation in ruined.

I wouldn't recommend the acne treatment unless your skin is as tough as leather, although I cant speak on the other treatments. My sister liked the botox if that means anything.

I went to get Botox and lip fillers. I was a little hesitant since I wasn't familiar with the place. But Thanh's service and the way she applied the products were great! I've been there for a week and the results were incredible! I'll definitely be back! ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼

reviews.text: Amazing singing bowl and healing session! With a 2 lovely cats in the building that welcoming us and guide us

My wife and I did the sound healing session together. The space is peaceful and comfortable, the host was gentle and professional. The session was a core memory experience! Both my wife and I individually noticed that our breathing became effortless. A must try for everyone!â¤ï¸

I had an incredible sound healing session with Thuang in Da Nang. From the moment I arrived, the atmosphere was peaceful and welcoming. Thuang has such a calm and caring energy. I immediately felt at ease with her.

Throughout the session, the sounds and vibrations flowed beautifully, helping me release tension and find a deep sense of calm and clarity. I could literally feel the stress melting away. By the end, I felt lighter, centered, and completely rejuvenated, as if both my body and mind had been reset.

It was truly a transformative experience. Thuangâ€™s intuitive approach and gentle guidance made it feel personal and deeply healing. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to relax, reconnect with themselves, or experience something genuinely uplifting while in Da Nang.

Absolutely amazing! I had a 1:1 sound healing session with Thuong, and it was everything I hoped for and more. Firstly, Thuong's energy is calming and grounding which helped with making the overall experience complete - upon meeting her you know you're in good hands. Secondly the space she has created in her studio is so special, it transports you to a realm of inner healing and prace as soon as you step into the room...the busy and noisy sounds of Danang just melt away. And lastly, the sound healing experience was next level. The vibrations, energy, and tones transports you into a peaceful realm, healing your nervous system, and refreshing your energy flow. She is a hidden gem. I highly recommend and I hope to have the opportunity to have another session soon!

Yesterday I had a full TokSen massage and it was a really thorough and intensive experience.
I can only give praise. The space was so comfortable, I was instantly able to feel relaxed and safe. The massage itself was meditative and non-invasive. The tapping allowed me to deeply feel the areas of attention. The massage lasted two hours though it felt a lot shorter.
My energy feels more grounded and flowing today. I really look forward to the next sessions. Highly recommend. Thank you ğŸ™

We found this little gem, Anny Spa & Nail, while traveling in Da Nang, and it was the best decision after a long day of touring! The girls here are sooo good at what they do, and the prices are incredibly affordable compared to other shops nearby (and without all the loud touting you often see).

The atmosphere is calm, clean, and relaxing, just what we needed. I tried their shampoo, face cleaning, and head-to-shoulder massage package, and it was heavenly! My mom especially loved the hot stone foot massage, and my dad, who has some swelling in his feet, was treated so gently and carefully that he actually fell asleep during the session.

The service is excellent, the ambiance is lovely, and the value for money is unbeatable. Highly recommend this place if youâ€™re looking for a relaxing, genuine pamper session in Da Nang!

One of the staff kindly offered to lend me a skirt and even ironed my skirt so that it will dry faster. My pedicure was done well and my husband had a good hot stone foot massage. They also offered complimentary water and fruits. A very pleasant experience overall.

****Scammy place be warned****- Big disappointment. Took my niece for a manicure service. I asked at the woman at the door if it included polish. She said yes. Another lady came over and handed my niece polish samples. Proceeded to do shellac and charge me 450,000 instead of 70,000 for a manicure. We donâ€™t want shellac on a 12 year old girl. We wanted a simple nail polish she could take off easily.

Response to the reply: you never offered my 12 year old niece a menu. We were sat next to her the entire time. We asked outside about the service and the polish it included. Once inside another staff handed my niece colour swatches and she chose a colour. The member of staff doing the nails didnâ€™t even speak English- so how did she communicate the inflated price and difference in service and swatches? I asked for a menu because I wanted to come back another time for a pedicure. There was no miscommunication. There was zero communication on your side as you wanted to make extra money as there was no one else in your salon

You lack integrity and lie. Itâ€™s on your conscience to make money by deceiving and lying to kids and tourists. Itâ€™s not honest and you are not good people. You will receive the karma you deserve

Be warned to ask about price before entering and ensure you arenâ€™t conned and pressured into paying 8times the initial price. Could get better shellac designs elsewhere for cheaper
Super kind manager! She was able to accommodate me at the last moment. Very sweet staff! Recommend

The 2 most caring lady's that I have met while travelling Vietnam for 1 month.
Healing hands and they have a very special knowledge of acupuncture pressure points and Massage technique.

reviews.text: I met Vivian the owner, while looking for an apartment. She told me she had a massage spa, therefore, I decided to try a therapy today. The young man who greeted me was very friendly and polite and brought me a coconut and peanut fudge. It was so nice! Then my massage therapist "Mung" came to greet me. She was so nice and friendly. I then opted for the 65 min hot stone massage treatment It was absolutely incredible! Mung worked on my back and shoulders and somehow identified my stiff left shoulder. It felt so much better after the treatment. I was then treated to tea and fruits after the session which was a very nice touch, as I wasn't expecting anything else. The massage experience overall was fantastic, that good that I am going to book another treatment tomorrow. The price was also very reasonable and I would highly recommend that you to try this spa for yourself. You will definitely not be disappointed and will totally agree with my review.

Really great experience, had the hot stone massage and energising facial. My therapist Ti, was very skilled and i was so relaxed for the entirety of the message and facial. Looking forward to my stay here at Pullman.

I was led to a huge massage room intended for couples although I was there by myself. Received a complimentary 30-min body scrub with my booking of a 60-min aromatic body massage. The body scrub didn't take 30 minutes (more like 15-20 minutes), then I was led to the shower room to wash off the scrub. The message was excellent and I enjoyed it.
The only (and big) let down was the lukewarm sauna and the steamroom! The temperature of both facilities was set to around 48 degree Celsius- which defeats the purpose of going in either! The jacuzzi streams were lacking strength, it wasn't bubbly nor delivering any relaxing effect. I'd expect much better given it is a nice hotel's facilities.

This was my first time at a spa so I was a little nervous, but the experience at Mint's Garden was absolutely INCREDIBLE!! I did a 4 month trip across Asia and this was hands down the highlight of it all

The staff here are super friendly. I don't speak any Vietnamese and it didn't matter at all, they took care of everything and all I had to do was relax and enjoy.

On Saturday I got the hot stone body massage and I was SO IMPRESSED I literally came back the next day to try their premium luxury hair wash treatment which was also absolutely phenomenal.

The thing I'll never forget is the smell of the oils they used. It was amazing and lasted for days, even after showering.

If I lived in Da Nang I would literally come here everyday for a hair wash because the price is insanely cheap for the clean feel, fresh smell and relaxing sensation that it gives.

Thank you Mint Garden for making my time in Da Nang so memorable!!  I'll see you again in two months ğŸ˜

I don't really like leaving negative reviews.
Although the price may be cheaper compared to places in busier areas, I wouldn't recommend it to people with sensitive skinï¼Œand especially to female customers.
For women who want to experience a hair wash, this place lacks privacy â€” the washing area is only separated from other customers by a thin curtain. You need to change into a strapless robe for washing hair.
After I left, I realized my neck and ears wasn't thoroughly cleaned â€” there was still foam behind my ears, which felt quite uncomfortable.
Maybe it's a local habit, but the water temperature was a bit cold, and the whole process wasnâ€™t very relaxing.
Overall, I donâ€™t think it was a good experience.

reviews.text: What a wonderful experience. We were greeted with hot tea and soft spa music the second we walked in. The staff are incredibly kind, gave a some time to sit and decide what treatments we wanted, then let us finish the tea before walking us upstairs to the treatment room. My husband and I opted for the 1.5 hours massage. The pressure started a little strong for me, but a quick comment to go softer, and I had the most relaxing pleasurable massage experience. We plan to make this our regular spot while weâ€™re here in Da Nang.

I have finally found a very good massage in Vietnam! They greet you with tea and snacks when you arrive and are so kind. The massage was absolutely fantastic and I will definitely be returning many times before I leave Da Nang. The masseuse listened to my needs and then expertly provided a beautiful massage. After the massage we were provided more tea, fresh fruit and hard boiled eggs. It was so lovely. I highly recommend L Spa.

J'y suis allÃ©e hier pour un massage du dos et de la tÃªte. C'est le meilleur massage que j'ai fait sur Da Nang. D'abord le lieu est trÃ¨s cosy trÃ¨s propre aussi. L'ambiance est douce. la lumiÃ¨re est tamisÃ©e et la petite musique qui va bien y est Ã©galement. Et au-delÃ  de ses dÃ©tails, Ã©videmment un massage de trÃ¨s grande qualitÃ©, je recommande vivement cet endroit pour une vraie expÃ©rience de Massage Ã  Da Nang

Absolute Bliss at an Unbeatable Price!

I had the pleasure of experiencing the Luxury 4-in-1 package at L Spa and it was nothing short of incredible. For just $78 AUD, I received 2.5 hours of pure indulgence â€“ easily one of the best spa experiences Iâ€™ve had, and such amazing value!

The session began with a 2-hour mixed style massage and the pressure was absolutely perfect â€“ firm where needed, gentle where it mattered, and always attentive to my comfort. The therapist clearly knew what she was doing, seamlessly blending different techniques for a deeply relaxing and therapeutic experience.

This was followed by a divine 30-minute facial that left my skin glowing and refreshed. Every step felt luxurious and tailored â€“ a perfect way to finish.

To top it all off, they served snacks and refreshments at the end, which was such a thoughtful touch. The staff spoke excellent English, making communication smooth and easy throughout.

From start to finish, this was a 5-star experience â€“ professional, welcoming, and deeply relaxing. If you're in need of some serious self-care without breaking the bank, L Spa is a must-visit.
The loveliest and very flexible service, very very good foot and back massages and very clean salon! Thank you so much <3
Service was phenomenal. Loved it. They even provide snacks pre and post massage.

Among a million spas on this street, L Spa really stands out. From the very first step inside, they make you feel comfortable, welcome, and genuinely listened to. Compared to many other places, here the staff actually hear what you wantâ€”no rushed treatment, just perfect timing, perfect pressure, and exactly as you asked for.

And then comes the legendary post-massage snack: tea, fruit, andâ€¦ hard-boiled eggs with salt that you peel yourself ğŸ¥šâœ¨. Totally unexpected, totally brilliant. My masseur? Number 09â€”yes, they go by numbers like secret agents, and honestly, I loved the mystery.

The only small downside: no card payment, so bring cash. But overall, this place is warm, quirky, and impeccable in detail. Iâ€™ll definitely be backâ€”thank you, L Spa!

Thanks to my husband, he manage to found one authentic gua sha service in Da Nang and according to the team, they served many locals. I had my head massage and therapist are skillful and I felt relaxed during the session. Thank you for the service and highly recommended!

This place is hit or miss.

The first time I came, I had a great experience. I got 20 minutes in a steam bath, then the masseuse told me it was time to get out to begin the massage. She used good pressure during the oil massage, and never made me feel she was in a rush,  unlike at Pink Rain and Blue Hanoi. That time, I would have said 5 stars.

The second time I went, however, was a total rip off.  It started as normal,  but the masseuse never told me when to come out of the steam bath. When I finally came out to get the massage, she had enough time to karate chop my back for 10 minutes, then the entire HOUR AND A HALF was up.  Yes, SHE LEFT ME IN THE STEAM BATH FOR OVER AN HOUR, WHILE SHE SCROLLED THROUGH HER PHONE.  I had to pay the full price, and explained everything to the manager at the reception.  No refund was offered.  That time would have received 0 stars. I was so irritated that I walked all the way back to SÆ¡n Tra!

There is no 2.5 star rating to illustrate the hit-or-miss-ness of this establishment, so it gets 3.  The price is cheaper than most, and there is always that 49% chance of a pleasant experience, but buyer be ware.

This place is amazing value.

While I don't get many, if I get a massage in Asia, hot stones or oil is a must. Those familiar know, but if you're new and from the land of $110/h massage therapists, in Asia they will wring you out like a wet towel (and sometimes hit you with a stick for some reason). Here, I got both, rocks and oil and it was the best money I've spent on my trip.

I read the reviews and decided to give this place a try, and I'm glad I did!  I had a 60 minute full body massage by Ana and it was awesome.  She's got a nice energy about her, she's calm and relaxed and that's a good thing when relaxation is what you're after.  That, and some good pressure to help soothe sore muscles.  She seems to have had some very good training and applies her skills well.

The owner was there and we talked for a bit afterwards and she's a lovely lady,  very friendly, and it was just a really positive experience overall.

Thanks ladies for creating a wonderful space for people to come and have a great massage!

At first, it seem little bit dirty - like i didnt know if the towels were washed in between customers.
But the price is so cheap for 60min foot massage (190,000). And for this price, they also give you some head/face/neck/arm massage and also give you hot rock massage at the end. My partner said her masseuse was very strong and great. My masseuse was not very strong, just so-so. So you should ask for strong masseuse.

Even if store feels not clean, you cannot complain for this price.

reviews.text: Very good massage. Thanks Ngan :)
Very happy with the massage and service from Ngan. Would recommend!!
Jeg anbefaler Phuc som massage terapeut! Hun er meget dygtig og stÃ¦rk!

We are 3 in the group and had 10am massage. They were able to get the therapist ready in 10mins even if it is early in the morning. They open as early as 9am. Receptionist (Ngan) is very friendly and cheerful. Therapist (Anh) is very good, she knows the right pressure points and cheerful as well. Will definitely recommend this. Full aroma therapy body massage is only VND 340,000 ğŸ˜Šâ¤ï¸

Excellent spa service. From Ngan in the reception who was very attentive, friendly and accommodation to the very capable and relaxing massage from Tram. The facility is also very clean, nice ambiance and relaxing. Happy with the overall experience!
Really enjoyed the spa. Massage was great. access to steam room & sauna is included for Free what a bonus! Thank you Ngan for a lovely service âœ¨

Splendid experience at V'SPA. I had a one-hour aroma massage with a masseuse named Hanh. She was skillful and professional and left me feeling better. I also enjoyed the complimentary sauna and steam room, the steam was just what I needed. The receptionist, HuyÃªn, spoke good English and was very polite and well trained. Thank you ğŸ™
The massage was very relaxing and good.
Happy with our stay. Staff are accommodating. Nice location. We will definitely go back in this hotel & recommend it to our family & friends.

Enjoyed a really nice back, neck and shoulders massage here, my wife also did a 90 min hot stone massage and we both really enjoyed the experience. The complimentary sauna/steam room was much appreciated and the ladies doing the massages are very skilled and good at what they do.

Overall itâ€™s a great value and a super nice experience. I can definitely recommend to anyone needing a relaxing massage.
It was perfect experience

My wife and I have been to this spa several times. Usually we are served tea, before and after the massage as  in most spas. Today, no tea served at all. The man at the desk asked for payment before I could sit down. Because of today's service we will never return. The massage today was average as well. Much better service and massages at both Jang mi and Bliss spas. There is too much competition in Danang to settle for poor service.
I had a wonderful aroma therapy massage at V'Spa. All the staff were amazing and Ngan was delightful at reception. Go visit them when you're in Danang - they won't disappoint!

went for a vietnamese massage for the first time here, it was a great experience as my masseuse applied good pressure and ensured i was okay throughout the session. the room is very spacious and price is reasonable as well

Great service! The body scrub is amazing, we went twice because it was so good. They really take time to provide the best experience. Also something I loved, each gender has their own changing room with lockers, so no worries about your belongings. Definitely recommend a visit or two.

Update: August 1st 2025
My husband and I were so excited to go back over a year later to get another wonderful massage and to relax. Unfortunately this was the worst massage we both have ever gotten. Clearly they no longer have therapist on staff. I don't know where they got my therapist, she came in looking sweaty and not put together. She lacked any knowledge of anatomy and I'm sure she's never been to a proper massage school because all she did was rub me in the same areas over and over again with her sharp bony thumb that was so irritating that I had to tell her a few times enough, her fingernails were sharp and dug into my skin and left scratches in several places on my back and side. I showed the receptionist, who took photos of it and said he would show it to the manager and apologized.
A professional massage therapist always has to keep their nails groomed.
At this time I'm sad to say don't waste your money, I would not recommend this spa until they can hire real massage therapist not someone that they just called off the street, probably working at one of the other spas along the roads that I usually avoid.

Review from 2024:
My husband and I stayed at the Avatar twice and we love the spa as they offer free steam and dry sauna weather you are staying here or with a purchase of a massage, this alone is a plus over the outside massage spas. The rooms are very clean and the therapist are professional and they don't talk much like the other shops that are so loud and noisy, they play nice calming music too.
So far I've been to 3 Asian countries and I like these girls the best.
The receptionist is so kind and very accommodating.
We will definitely be back next time we are in Da nang.
I forgot to mention the prices are great!

My wife and I visited M'Healthy Spa and enjoyed the Thai Massage (one hour long) there. Absolutely wonderful experience.

It all started with a friendly welcome and a foot bath with warm water, lime and flowers, which puts you in the mood on the spot :) We were also offered tea and tasty cookies.

Then we were taken upstairs for massage.
Beautiful, spacy enough room, professional massage tables, can use toilet and shower (also meticulously clean).

The massage itself was professional, with all the stretching and relaxation you need.
A special treat were the warming cushion for the neck, mask for the eyes and socks for the feet.

After the massage we were offered delicious mango and yogurt.

Finally, we received a free taxi ride back to our hotel (such rides are offered for couples both from and to the hotel, but we chose to walk to the M'Healthy, as we live nearby).

Many thanks to our friendly hosts and my best recommendations to everyone - you will definitely enjoy visiting M'Healthy Spa!

Absolutely the best!
If you're staying nearby, this place is a must-visit.
We dropped by without a reservation just because it was close on Google Maps, and it ended up being our favorite experience.

Unlike some other places where staff talk a lot during the massage, here they were fully focused with minimal conversation, giving their best effort throughout.
Massage quality can really vary depending on the therapist, right? But every member of our family was completely satisfied here.
If we come back to Da Nang, weâ€™ll definitely return â€” 100%!

While we were getting massages, the staff even took great care of our kids who werenâ€™t getting massages. They prepared snacks and a cozy space for them to relax. It was really touching.
If you make a reservation at least 60 minutes in advance, they offer pick-up and drop-off service, plus a 10% discount â€” just so you know!

I hope this place continues to offer such excellent service for a long time.
See you again next time!

I left feeling refreshed, calm, and genuinely grateful. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great massage and warm service.

Overall, Maison Spa delivered exceptional service and a truly relaxing atmosphere. Iâ€™ll definitely be back.

She kept removing and applying the polish, but as you can see from the photos, to no success.

reviews.text: This is a nice massage spa that also has house made kombucha. We walked by and were drawn in by the adorable and super friendly dog. The space is welcoming and you can book online and also chat with them on Whatsapp. We got the happy hour massage offer, 1 hour for 199k VND. It was excellent. The ladies who worked on us really massaged out our tense muscles and bones. We left very limber and relaxed. They also give you a glass of their kombucha at the end. If you're staying a long time, they also have a loyalty card with discounts on their hair and massage services. Highly recommend!

It is the place where the god of massage is.
It's a completely local massage shop, and I think there are one or two masseurs with the owner, but I got it from the owner.
It was the coolest, most powerful, and comfortable massage I've ever received in my life, and I thought this was Mureungdowon. The price is ridiculously cheap. I received a 60-minute shampoo care and upper body massage course, and I went to a world of paradise massage that cannot be described in words because it even includes hot stones. This trip is for 8 nights and 9 days, and it's so lamentable that I came on the last day of Da Nang. I'll definitely come next time. For your information, it takes less than 5 minutes on foot because it is near Temhaisan Mountain, a popular shrimp seafood restaurant that Koreans like. It's a store that only I want to know, but I hope it's widely known so that we can go to Massage Mureungdowon together. The puppy in the massage shop is also very cute.

We came here 2-3 times before and had a great neck, shoulder, and back massage and they even served tea and yogurt at the end. It was so relaxing. They recently changed their massage protocol and now itâ€™s the worst Iâ€™ve ever had. All she did was hit and slap me. Never returning again.
Clean and professional massage, friendly shop assistant. Need to wait for 5-10 mins masseuse to come, which is ok. Cash or bank transfer only.

I recently had the pleasure of experiencing a hot stone massage at Vita Spa in Da Nang, and I can't say enough good things about it! From start to finish, the entire experience was nothing short of exceptional.

The moment I walked into Vita Spa, I was greeted with a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The staff was friendly and professional, making me feel comfortable and relaxed right from the beginning. They took the time to explain the hot stone massage process and answer any questions I had, which immediately put me at ease.

The massage room itself was a tranquil oasis. The soft lighting, soothing music, and aromatic scents created the perfect ambiance for relaxation. The massage therapist was highly skilled and clearly knowledgeable about hot stone massage techniques. They used just the right amount of pressure and expertly placed the heated stones on my body to melt away tension and stress.

The sensation of the hot stones combined with the therapist's skillful hands was pure bliss. It was as if the stones had an innate ability to find and release all the knots and tightness in my muscles. Throughout the massage, I felt a profound sense of relaxation and well-being that I haven't experienced in a long time.

What truly sets Vita Spa apart is their attention to detail. They provided a post-massage refreshment that was a delightful touch to conclude the experience. The entire visit left me feeling rejuvenated, refreshed, and utterly pampered.

If you're looking for a top-notch hot stone massage experience in Da Nang, Vita Spa is the place to go. Their skilled therapists, serene atmosphere, and commitment to customer satisfaction make it a must-visit destination for relaxation and self-care. I can't wait to return and indulge in their services again.

I've been visiting semi-regularly for the past year and I'm always impressed by the quality of masaage at Nirva Spa. They ask what you are looking for and make sure to communicate it to the therapist. The have a number of male therapists if that's what you are looking for, and I've never been disappointed. The space itself is very clean and relaxing, but the best part is the warm and welcoming staff and owners. Tonight it started to rain during my massage and the owner was waiting downstairs to offer a ride home. You don't get this level of service even at more expensive spas. Top-notch all around.

Thank you for your kind welcome and smile, even though I visited late at night.
Massage prices are also relatively cheap in Da Nang.

The mango jelly and yogurt they served after the massage were delicious.

They even drove me safely to the airport.

I'll definitely be back.

I wish you continued success!

The best bamboo massage. I recommend to try it was amazing and such a relief for your back and shoulder pain. Start they give the customer the welcome snack after the massage a finale snack. The best no.1.

I visited this place because I had a 50% discount on spa. I received an aroma massage for 120 minutes, and I am satisfied with it. It is done except for the face and front of the upper body. Take a shower before the massage and receive it. Is it natural to apply aroma oil!
They give tea and snacks when they arrive, but the taste is not good whether the snacks are damp or the original snacks are like that.
Massage intensity. Select and check the aroma scent, etc., and start by deducting the amount including the tip (70 million dong).
If you don't have a 50% discount coupon. I think it's expensive. I paid 500,000 dongs including tips for 90 minutes of aroma. Because it was one person, I couldn't even receive pickup and drop services.

4,5/5 â­
TL;DR High quality Spa, higher prices then average, quality massage with great customer care.

Padma Spa is a high quality Massage place.
The ambiance is calm & luxurious with relaxing jazz music playing in the background.

The massage it self is very relaxing & was done with great care. They didn't use an excessive amount of oil & made sure to wipe of all of the oil after the massage was over.
The pressure of the massage was on point & the therapist always made sure if I'm ok.

They offered me tea & water and also had some free snacks available.

The only downside I found is that the massage was on the more pricer side. 450.000 VND for 60 minutes (body massage). The normal going rate is around 300.000 VND.
I still think the price is fair for what you get tho.

Safety Concerns & Poor Service Standards

I recently visited this spa with my friends on 7th September and was quite shocked by the experience. My friend opted for a foot massage, during which the masseur used hot stones and accidentally scalded her thigh. This is extremely concerning â€” especially since we later saw a review from two weeks ago mentioning another customer whose nose was scalded during a treatment. This suggests a pattern and a serious lapse in customer safety. The owner should immediately suspend hot stone treatments until proper training and safety protocols are enforced.

As for my own experience, I did a body scrub and massage. The room was very dim, and when we turned on the light to place our belongings, the masseur came in right away and turned it off â€” which felt odd and made us uncomfortable. The flooring was worn out, and towels were stored untidily on open shelves â€” not the hygiene standard you'd expect from a professional spa.

The treatment itself also raised concerns. The masseur did the massage first, then the scrub, which seems backward. Iâ€™ve always understood it should be the scrub first to cleanse the skin, then the massage. It became clear the masseur wasnâ€™t fully trained â€” another masseur had to tell her what to do during the session.

Overall, this was an unsettling experience, and I sincerely hope the owner takes urgent steps to address both the safety hazards and the lack of training among staff. Customer wellbeing must come first.

Minluxury Spa is good. I experienced a pleasant spa in Da Nang. My friend is getting her nails done, so I had about an hour left, so it wasn't that far from the Han market, but I happened to see a Minluxury Spa while walking. I went to a Minluxury Spa because I thought I could get a pedicure because I didn't have much money in Vietnam. As expected, I had about 30 minutes for my pedicure. So I asked if I could get an oil massage, but when I saw that I didn't have enough money to get an oil massage, the manager of Minluxury Spa said he would do it for 60 minutes. If you go to Minluxury Spa, you can see Nam Hee-seok's picture and there are a lot of pictures. They are clean and not like a local massage shop. The price is good. I just went to Bana Hill, so I took a shower before I got a massage because I was sweating. The manager gave me a very meticulous massage. In particular, I could choose oil, but I chose jasmine and put something on my nose, but my nose was crooked. It was great. I should go again tomorrow. Da Nang Minlux Spa is highly recommended. It was good enough to go again tomorrow.

I will definitely return because the experience was relaxing, professional, and worth every penny.
The therapist clearly knew what she was doing, the massage pressure was just right, and I felt every muscle in my body relax by the end of the session.
I visited during my weekend off, hoping to unwind, and the experience completely exceeded my expectations, it was peaceful, clean, and perfectly relaxing.
The staff were very attentive from the moment I arrived, the music, lighting, and scent created the perfect mood, and the massage truly released all my stress.

I found this spa on Google Maps and decided to try, it turned out to be a great choice.
This place is well maintained and very professional, I can recommend it without hesitation.

I came with a friend and we both agreed this is one of the best spas in the area.

Just went here a while ago, it was very near my Airbnb so I wanted to try getting a massage. I think they close at 12MN but I arrived there at around 11:30PM. They still accepted me but with additional 20k overtime fee which was okay with me. It was a very humble place, but wow the lady who massaged me was very good!! I really needed that massage. They served me water upon arriving, then orange juice after the massage. I felt great! When I come back to Da Nang next time, I will definitely visit them again. â™¡

so I mean it was okay...not quite sure how they got such a high rating on here (which is how I selected them) but I think they went under a business change recently, at least have a different name.   Regardless my 60 minute massage was about 50-51 minutes which was fairly disappointing. I don't know if they just include the time you're drinking tea or juice too haha?  but they also forgot to do the hot stones which the front desk specifically noted was included to me. also in the laying down massage room would be good to have the bright light in the corner off (or put something gentle over clients eyes when on back). so there's room for improvement here

reviews.text:
Donâ€™t sleep on this place (well actually you CAN sleep) but seriously, the masseuses here are no joke. Super skilled, clearly trained, and I feel like they know what theyâ€™re doing (the only reason i let them step on my back). The service overall is excellent: welcoming, clean-ish (maybe consider cleaning the bed covers a bit more often then i'll update my review and remove the ish), really nicely decorated place and not crazily jackedup price like some other places in Son Tra. So yea you heard it from a local massage connoisseur: skip the other places with like a fake 4.9 star and go here if you want to get your muscles kneaded like sourdough.

***Now, this part is for the people who are absolutely crazy and borderline masochistic about massages (like me): I'm not giving it a full 10/10 on my very personal, extremely picky massage scale, it's like a 8ish/10. The reason is I like a bit more strength on my muscles instead of stroking (they sprinkle this in occasionally), I think it couldâ€™ve been just a bit more heavyhanded in a couple of spots, but again, weâ€™re talking minor nitpicks from someone who's been to more massage places than family gatherings.... I had a lovely foot massage after several days of walking around Da Nang. It was very relaxing. The spa is very clean and serene. I recommend them.

Iâ€™ve been to Tigon Spa twice now, and Iâ€™ll more than likely come back again while Iâ€™m staying in Da Nang. I usually get the herbal bath and sauna package. The first time, I booked the VIP single room, and the second time, I tried the regular room â€” both were absolutely amazing.

If you prefer a bit of privacy and donâ€™t feel like interacting with others, I recommend the VIP option. But if you donâ€™t mind sharing space, the regular room is perfectly fine. The facilities are beautiful, and the staff is truly world-class.

I booked the 120-minute service (Iâ€™ve been an athlete for a while, so my body is always full of knots) with Theo â€” I might be spelling that wrong â€” and she is incredible. Very strong, very consistent, and both of my massages with her were equally amazing. I came in with so much pain, and now I feel like I can fly.

They do have a required tip policy that I wasnâ€™t aware of when I booked. They texted me about it beforehand, and I almost canceled my appointment. But the staff was so kind that I decided to go anyway â€” and honestly, after experiencing their service, that tip isnâ€™t nearly enough.

The spa is spotless and smells absolutely divine.

Thank you, ladies â€” youâ€™re amazing!
Best service in the town!
Muy buen servicio a buen precio
